channel.title: Mopar closes, then what?
channel.description:
As you all know, the scene of Runescape cheating has gone through many changes. Originally it started with a select few people who developed applications allowing for players to have an unfair advantage. 'Auto-clickers' and loads of other VB applications were released. Eventually, cheating progressed and the key individuals created their communities as well as their own little programs. The community before moparscape? Mitb. The community before Mitb? Kaitnieks. Follow the line back and it takes you back to a place called Bovine. Throw RSCN in there somewhere too. Even earlier? I believe it was the Free Games Forum but my memory is foggy. We're talking a decade i think now.
Each time a community was shut down, another rose up. The new community was always filled with the older members. The soul of Runescape cheating was the experienced. The people carried on the information, community to community. It was common to see staff from a shut down place, create the next part of the story. Mopar himself was staff at Kaitnieks. As are many of the long-time staff here.
So what do you believe will happen once Mopar closes? Will a staff member here create the next watering hole for keen cheaters? Villavu has always remained strong, having it's backbone as Simba. There's always been the other side of the scene too. The ugly cousin i guess. Sythe. It too has it's own timeline. RuneCMS. However, Sythe chose to dedicate most of his forums to marketplace.
I think the end of Mopar will spell the death for the scene. It's too diluted with private servers, no important information is documented and a lot of the knowledgeable members have left a long time go. The landscape has changed.
Opinions?

item.title: Mopar closes, then what?
item.dc:creator: @EcoPS_GM EcoPS GM
item.description:
@EcoPS_GM wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:125, topic:469355”][quote author=jme link=topic=586519.msg4496437#msg4496437 date=1443361394]

But in all seriousness are the staff thinking about it or something?

It’s not closing anytime soon. Mopar is even changing the forum software and moving away from SMF
[/quote]

To what, may I ask?

Well I tried discourse, but the conversion tool is total crap and after a few days it’s clear I’ll have to write my own conversion tool if we want to go there. NodeBB looks like a strong contender too. Anyone have any other suggestions?[/quote]
NodeBB looks nice, that’s actually the first time I’ve heard of it. I’ll have to do some research on this. However, as kamarscape stated, myBB is a nice one.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar closes, then what?
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:120, topic:469355”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=586519.msg4496519#msg4496519 date=1443457308]

On a side note, the forums outside of the advertisement/project section would probably be a lot more active and populated with interesting threads; however from my perspective: I am scared of posting anything on here.
If someone posts a guide or a tutorial that’s (in their view, brilliant) not ‘optimal’; they might get mauled by the community.
Doesn’t even have to be a guide, sometimes it can just be a post about… I dunno, cats. I’ve been here a long time (not sure whether to feel happy or sad about it), coming in and going out every few months; each time the once-active sections have slowed (probably to do with the decline of RS/RSPS in general).

Anyways, the main point of my post was: It is scary to post anything because other community members might attack with pitchforks and torches.

This made me realise that I’ve barely posted any topics in the entire time I’ve been here…

Stack exchange has filled the gap for most of the boards on moparscape imo, so most people don’t really have any reason to post here unless it’s directly related to RSPS. Take programming help for example - am I going to ask here and either get abused, or worse just ignored because nobody knows the answer. No, I’m going to ask a global community who are collectively very knowledgable and actually give constructive answers.
[/quote]

I’d ask here first just because I’m more comfortable here. Nothing wrong with asking either places. If it’s reasonable you won’t get too much shit here[/quote]

we post here because this community is special.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar closes, then what?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:115, topic:469355”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=586519.msg4494247#msg4494247 date=1440526437]

I have read the first two pages or so and then stopped reading. So don’t kill me if I say something that has been said. I’ve seen multiple persons asking why the younger generation and other players go to r-s. Someone have suggested badges and I do think it has to do something with that. On r-s you have the thank system and you also have the how more you post the higher ‘rank’ you get. You get something for posting on the forums. Something like our old rep system and the moparian reward for the 2000 posts made. You get recognition for your posts and work. Isn’t that what we all want. Something in return for our effort and time. I think that is more appealing at r-s. Especially for the younger generations coming in. As a kid all I wanted was that 200 rep and that moparian rank. Now it really doesn’t bother me that much anymore. I’ve learned here that it’s better to make a good server or post and get no recognition at all than to re-release something bad or make some stupid posts and get thanked, repped and honored. The best thing is to give something back to the community as they helped me getting this ‘far’. As for the runescape cheating part? It never was a big deal on these forums. It always was about the private server creating. That’s what I know moparscape for.
[/quote]Yeah, everybody pretended rep wasn’t a big deal but was probably a major driver in how much they contributed to the community.

I can definitely say in the past when I was younger, it was like that for me. As sad as that is but I do believe you’re right for about most of the people here, at least once in their past here.[/quote]

Yeah when i was a bit younger and way more into rsps rep actually mattered a shit ton to me. Eventually you realized after being apart of the community for so long (and being at the cap of 200) that it was literally worthless. I was eventually rep locked for abuse, even though i don’t remember there being any guidelines for how to use it. Which now that I think about it was probably a huge problem. There were no guidelines and few rules to go along with it so basically you just did whatever you wanted. It became a ‘oh this post is funny here is some rep’ instead of ‘this is a good contribution to the community, here’s some rep’.

Read full topic

The scene is dead but there are communities outside of a forum.

All I have to say is… when mopar dies… I need to make sure to have one hell of a harddrive before it happens to get download links etc.

Then when the chaos begins I can be like selling blah blah for blah blah. But in all seriousness are the staff thinking about it or something? Kind of a … strange topic to even think about. I always kind of thought everyone else would die first.

item.title: Mopar closes, then what?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:3, topic:469355”][quote author=casey. link=topic=586519.msg4164107#msg4164107 date=1353471067]
When the last divide happened, I was one of the people who went to sythe. I’m not even active there anymore, but I can say that site has no potential on changing the cheating scene. Years ago they had some great programmers who chose sythe over srl, mitb, etc but they are since gone. No cheating has happened on MITB in years, so whatever is around now will remain(RID, Villavu, etc)

Now I don’t think any member from this site has the capability to do that as well. IMO RL AND R-S are far more progressive than our site and will continue to be the top sites(server wise). All that will remain in terms of mopar is #Mopar(a testament to what happened with the death of MITB forums).

[/quote]

I just wonder where the member base will flock to. Sadly, I agree with you on the RL and R-S opinion. That would really spell the end to what you and I knew as ‘Runescape Cheating’.[/quote]#mitb would still be alive and well.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar closes, then what?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Tom:

The whole reputation system is very regrettable, both in how it was managed and how no replacement was issued, ever. As it stands, we either reissue the same system under new management or have it removed, like it is now. That seems to be the fundamental description of the situation.

What are you waiting for, reissue it!

Read full topic
